page.title: 18Adisham Associations
page.content: There are several clubs in Adisham. The Parish Council runs a weekly evening Youth Club. There is a Cricket Team and a Gardening Club. The village has its own branch of the Women's Institute who meet in the hall. Both Church and Chapel hold a Women's Fellowship, and the Chapel Sunday School provides outings for the children, and other activities. During the winter there is also an indoor Badminton Club and Keep Fit classes. Parents organise a playgroup twice a week for children under school age, and a baby sitting service exists. Dancing classes are held for girls, with a few boys. A company of Girl Guides meets in the village hall, as does one of the Brownies, but they are run by a neighbouring parish. Boys who want to belong to Scouts or Cubs have to travel to outlying villages for meetings.
